> I am Associate professor at [HEC Montr√©al](https://www.hec.ca/en/profs/amine.ouazad.html)'s Department of Economics. My research was cited in [Congressional hearings](https://youtu.be/c9lrud-Uaok?t=2610), in the Financial Times, Wall Street Journal, New York Times, CBS, Bloomberg, Politico, etc.  I serve on the [scientific](https://www.areuea.org/international) and [awards committees](https://www.areuea.org/awards-committee) of the American Real Estate and Urban Economics Association, and the scientific committee of the [Urban Economics Association](https://urbaneconomics.org/meetings/). Previously I was an associate professor at Ecole polytechnique, France, an associate professor at Rutgers Business School, New Jersey, and an assistant professor at INSEAD, Fontainebleau. In April 2020, I was appointed DLA Piper Distinguished Visiting Professor of Economics at Johns Hopkins University. I was a Senior Fellow of Johns Hopkins' 21st Century Cities Initiative. I taught (and perhaps mostly learnt from !) over 5,000 students, mostly executives, across Canada, the United Kingdom, France, Singapore, South Africa, and the United Arab Emirates, in the EMBA, MBA, PhD, MSc, undergraduate programs.
